record.title: JOHN EDWARD "HUTCH" HUTCHINSON
record.narrative:
JOHN EDWARD "HUTCH" HUTCHINSON -- (House of Representatives - December 13, 2007)

[Page: H15419]
(Mr. TIM MURPHY of Pennsylvania asked and was given permission to address the House for 1 minute and to revise and extend his remarks.)

speaking.paragraph: Madam Speaker, Greensburg, Pennsylvania, a town in my congressional district, is lucky to have had their fire chief for 55 years. John Edward Hutchinson, who prefers to be known just as Hutch, first took office in 1952, and he has no intention of slowing down. Were he standing with me, he would say that he simply wants to help.
And help he has. From developing training programs and specialized teams in his department to establishing burn classes in local schools, Hutch has put in countless hours of service to the community.

But it's not just Southwestern Pennsylvania that has benefited from Hutch's time as fire chief. Hutch has organized his teams to assist the victims of natural disasters throughout the country from hurricanes to floods.
Hutch always shies from attention, but he deserves our recognition for 55 years of tireless service to the community.
